channel.title: Commands one use only?
channel.description:
hey, i made a command for starters, how do i make it so that it can only be used once, then if they try it a second time they will be warned and everyone will no, then thrid time kicked, and fourth time banned,
thanks for any help gorey

item.title: Commands one use only?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“jacked4fun1, post:5, topic:245955”][code] if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“starter”)) {
if (starter == 0) {
addItem(995, 15000000);
addItem(392, 1500);
sendMessage(“Go to the skilling area on the emote tablet if you need more money.”);
starter = 1;
savemoreinfo();
savechar();
} else if (starter == 1) {
sendMessage("Sorry " + playerName + ", but… ");
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
+ " tried getting more than one starter package lulz ");

        }
    }[/code]that is the base this is what makes it so you can only do it once[code]                starter = 1;
            savemoreinfo();
            savechar();
        } else if (starter == 1) {
            sendMessage("Sorry " + playerName + ", but... ");
            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
                    + " tried getting more than one starter package lulz :D ");[/code]starter ==0 means that its not used once it is used once the server the 0 turns to 1 which just takes away the add item code not that hard[/quote]

That will not work, as your server is multi-threaded and each time a client connects it will allocate it a new client object, and upon that initialization, starter is assigned 0. Which means, they could log in, execute the command, log out, and execute it again. You need to keep track of them by a hash of the username in a collection.

Read full topic

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
+ " tried getting more than one starter package lulz ");

        } else if (starter == 1) {
            sendMessage("Sorry " + playerName + ", but... ");
            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
                    + " tried getting more than one starter package lulz :D ");[/code]starter ==0 means that its not used once it is used once the server the 0 turns to 1 which just takes away the add item code not that hard
